column2: the storks of Stork Mountain delivered babies to families around the world
column3: until one stork named Jasper attempted to keep an infant girl for himself. Jasper accidentally destroyed the infant's address beacon and went into exile. Unable to deliver the orphaned girl
column4: the storks adopted her under the name Tulip. CEO stork Hunter discontinued baby delivery in favor of package delivery with Cornerstore.com. Eighteen years later
column7: tries to promote new ideas for Cornerstore
column8: which backfire and cause the company to lose stocks. Hunter declares her to be a severe burden and liability due to this incompetence (the charts also justify this
column9: as every time she tries to help
column11: and when they do make progress
column12: it is when she's absent). Hunter assigns top delivery stork Junior to fire Tulip so he may be promoted to boss. Junior cannot bring himself to do so and instead transfers Tulip to the mail room. Meanwhile
column13: a young boy named Nate Gardner
column14: who lives with his workaholic parents Henry and Sarah
column15: is feeling lonely and wants a younger sibling. He sends a letter to Cornerstore and it reaches Tulip
column16: who enters the defunct baby factory and inserts the letter into the baby-making machine
column17: causing it to create a pink-haired infant girl. Junior injures his wing trying to shut down the machine. Afraid Hunter will fire him
column18: Junior agrees to accompany Tulip and secretly deliver the baby to her family using a makeshift flying craft that Tulip invented. They eventually crash
column19: escape a pack of wolves that fall in love with the baby
column21: during which Junior and Tulip bond with the baby and name her Diamond Destiny. In the meantime
column22: Henry and Sarah open up to Nate's desire for a younger sibling and spend time with their son by building a landing platform for the storks. Junior and Tulip encounter Jasper
column23: who had followed them from Stork Mountain. Jasper has nearly repaired Tulip's delivery beacon
column25: which had been in Tulip's possession for years. Junior confesses to Tulip that he was supposed to fire her
column26: and a saddened Tulip leaves with Jasper to meet her family while Junior continues alone to deliver Diamond Destiny. Cornerstore's pigeon employee Toady learns about Diamond Destiny and informs Hunter
column27: who reroutes her address beacon and leads Junior into a trap. Hunter fires Junior and has Diamond Destiny taken away to live with penguins until she is an adult in order to silence the incident and prevent more plummeting stocks. Tulip reunites with Junior and they return to Stork Mountain during the highly anticipated Storkcon event to save Diamond Destiny from the penguins. When they are cornered in the baby factory by Hunter and the other stork employees

column29: causing it to rapidly produce babies and distract the storks. Hunter seizes control of a giant crane and tries to destroy the factory
column30: only to have Diamond Destiny and abused birds help make the Cornerstore building collapse off Stork Mountain
column32: who is trapped inside the crane and unsuccessfully attempts to kill Junior and Tulip

column42: graduating and getting married. Nate is at first not happy about not getting a little brother but quickly cheers up upon seeing his new sister's ninja skills. Tulip finally meets her family
column43: and Junior and Tulip continue working as co-bosses at Stork Mountain.
